channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024010113
item.description:
Report X-2024010113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT HAD FROST FORMING AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 6Y07Y1, SMART WAREHOUSING, 16500 E TRUMAN RD., INDEPENDENCE MO 64050-4159.

item.title: Report X-2024010129
item.description:
Report X-2024010129

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING INSPECTION AND CLEAN UP RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 4LITER PLASTIC BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID IN WHICH 1 BOTTLE LEAKED AT THE CLOSURE. THE REMAINING BOTTLES WERE CONTAMINATED, ENTIRE CONTENTS PROCESSED THRU DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023120654
item.description:
Report X-2023120654

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet, leaking a red liquid. The PH tagging on bank 3 called out for QA for assistance. Package was picked up and was taken off the warehouse floor and isolated from the rest of the employees. Package did have Fully Regulated HazMat labeling for Corrosive materials. DescribePack: The one plastic container inside had its cap badly bent to the side, which caused Hazardous Materials to leak. Upon investigation the container did not have any safety seal underneath to prevent leaks. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap loosened and caused the contents to spill out and leaked in the box that lead to the box breaking. DescribePack: the caps weren't tightened correctly DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: we moved the hazardus material to our hazmat cage away from being able to harm anyone and put the contents in a drum so it didn't get all over while we wait to process this report.
